conclusion: Formula for magnetic flux is Phi = BA cos(theta)
Change in magnetic flux is Delta Phi = Phi_final - Phi_initial
Magnetic field B is in the positive x-direction
Coil ABCO is in the xy-plane with points O, C on x-axis, A on z-axis, B in xz-plane
Coil ABCO is a flat surface in the xz-plane
Area vector for surface in xz-plane is in positive y-direction
Angle between magnetic field B and initial area vector is 90 degrees
Initial magnetic flux Phi_initial = BA cos(90 degrees) = 0 Wb
Coil rotates 60 degrees downward around the z-axis
Plane of coil makes an angle with xz-plane after rotation
Area vector rotates and has components in y and x directions
Normal vector rotates 60 degrees downward around z-axis
Normal vector is at angle of 60 degrees with y-axis and 30 degrees with x-axis
Final angle theta_final between magnetic field B and new area vector is 30 degrees
Phi_final = BA cos(theta_final) = BA cos(30 degrees)
Given B = 0.1 T and A = 0.4 m^2
Phi_final = (0.1 T)(0.4 m^2) cos(30 degrees) = 0.02sqrt(3) Wb
Using sqrt(3) approx 1.732
Delta Phi = Phi_final - Phi_initial = 0.02sqrt(3) Wb - 0 Wb = 0.02sqrt(3) Wb
Final answer is 0.02sqrt(3)
